title: Easy Steps to Hide Your LinkedIn Connections on Desktop & Mobile

steps.title: Click the Me button in the upper-right corner.
steps.content: Click the Me button in the upper-right corner. It has a thumbnail of your profile picture, as well.

steps.title: Choose Settings & Privacy.
steps.content: Choose Settings & Privacy . It's the first option under "Account."

steps.title: Click Visibility in the left-hand sidebar.
steps.content: Click Visibility in the left-hand sidebar. It's got an icon of an eye.

steps.title: Click Who can see your connections.
steps.content: Click Who can see your connections . It's the fifth button on the list.

steps.title: Change the setting to Off.
steps.content: Change the setting to Off . Your connections are now hidden from everyone on LinkedIn. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Search a connection's name or click their picture to visit their profile.
steps.content: Search a connection's name or click their picture to visit their profile. Searching works on either desktop or mobile. You can also select "My Network" menu, then "Connections" in the dropdown or near the top of your screen on the LinkedIn mobile app. Scroll through your connections and click on the connectionâ€™s name or profile picture to access their page. steps.title: Access their connections list.
steps.content: Access their connections list. Under their profile picture, there will be a link to their connections with a number stating how many connections they have. Click on that link to open their connections. [3] X Research source

steps.title: View their connections.
steps.content: View their connections. The filters at the top of the connections list allow you to customize and limit your search. Click All filters to view all available sorting filters for the user's connections. [4] X Research source
